name: Springhill Suites Colorado Springs South

reviews.text: Our family of four (2 teen-age boys) stayed here for a visit to the Colorado Springs area. The property was new, clean and comfortable. No hesitation recommending it. If you are planning on visiting the Olympic Training Center, Air Force Academy, Garden of the Gods, Pikes Peak, etc., be aware that you will need to drive 20-25 minutes to them.
reviews.title: Great property but kind of out of the way

reviews.text: The area is mostly industrial without many dining options. The only grocery store is about 1/2 mile away.
reviews.title: Absolutely perfect and a great value!

reviews.text: I felt we received good value for the stay despite the minor inconveniences. I'm not sure if I would stay again but it is only based on location. As I stated above, the service, staff and rooms were perfect.
reviews.title: Great Family stay at a great price.

reviews.text: We stayed here for a total of 4 nights. We actually had planned on only staying one night but once we walked in, we changed our reservations elsewhere and stayed here. The hotel seems new (not sure when actually built). It was very welcoming, clean, beds were comfortable with lots of pillows, and rooms were SPACIOUS! Rooms also had a wet bar, refrigerator, and microwave. The pullout sofa was perfect as we have 5 in our family. Everything was extremely clean! Breakfast was good--included hot foods as well as your typical hotel breakfast. The only negative was they only had one waffle maker and on this holiday weekend the hotel was packed so the line was long. The staff was friendly and seemed to remember us each time we entered and exited. There was an indoor pool, although we didn't have time to use it.
reviews.title: Clean and Quiet

reviews.text: This hotel is near the airport but don't let that stop you. We were still close to everything and there is a large shopping/restaurant area within 5 minutes. We didn't feel like we were ever out of the way of the attractions. And, the bonus for us was that this hotel was a lot less expensive than others. We felt like we were in a higher-class hotel rather than an economically priced property. And, the view of Cheyenne Mountain and Pike's Peak was definitely a happy sight each morning!
reviews.title: Best value, greatest service!

reviews.text: No problems at this hotel. Clean, nice, good pool, nice breakfast. This breakfast included make them yourself waffles, which I always enjoy. The juices and coffee were good as were the danishes and cereals. My kids enjoyed the pool. It was nothing spectacular, but a nice place to cool off and splash around.
reviews.title: Stayed for 3 days....would stay again!

reviews.text: The hotel was an easy drive to downtown, to Garden of the Gods, and to Pikes Peak. Everything was an easy drive from this location, and it was nice to be not in the middle of too much action! There are some decent restaurants, like Chilis, Mimis, etc just down the road, so access to those was easy as well.
reviews.title: next best thing to home

reviews.text: Complaints? There was one night when our next door neighbors were a little loud (at 1 AM) and when we called the front office, they did contact the room and try to quiet them. The walls were a little thin, if I do say so.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In addition, my dad did not find the beds to be very comforable. He commented that they needed to replace the mattresses. I found my bed to be fine.
reviews.title: Very nice rooms

reviews.text: The breakfast was great and had variety on different. days. The staff was so kind and interested in their guest. The rooms were clean and spacious with comfortble beds.
reviews.title: Very clean; great customer service; weird location (9 miles to Manitou)

reviews.text: Nice four story hotel, but obviously made mostly out of wood, and disappointed in lack of noise reduction construction methods. Can often hear neighbors moving about and can hear the jailhouse type locks several rooms down. Room doors need to be sealed better. Internet limited to 400K unless you are willing to pay $9 a day (a new concept!).
reviews.title: Nice Hotel - But can be noisy - Free Internet Limited to 400K

reviews.text: Great continental breakfast with waffles. Staff was great. They
reviews.title: Extremely comfortable place for business travelers

reviews.text: I had a cozy and highly affordable stay in this spacious Springhill Suites location. The staff members were extremely friendly, breakfast was great, and I felt right at home.
reviews.title: Quite Acceptable Suite Hotel

reviews.text: I have staed at this hotel about 5 times in the last year.
reviews.title: Wakened by man sneezing and blowing nose.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It is quite near the airport and Peterson AFB and is a convenient place to stay. There is suprisingly little outside noise but some room-to-room noise.
reviews.title: Best Place I've Ever Stayed

reviews.text: Best points: Very Clean, comfortable accommodations; Very polite, pleasant customer service oriented staff (from check in, breakfast, and housekeeping); 2 queen (vs. double) beds with separate living area; Free Wifi;
reviews.title: USAFA Visit

reviews.text: Potential area of improvement: Wifi (very, very slow); could use some basic utensils in kitchen area; possibly expanding exercise room/equipment if possible
reviews.title: Clean, new, friendly, helpful, good service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel is centrally located for sightseeing in Colorado Springs. Close to tons of attractions & shopping. We were looking for a hotel that we would stay at frequently over the next 4 years while our son is at USAFA. Although it is a bit of a drive to USAFA, we would definitely recommend this hotel overall. In my opinion, it is well managed.
reviews.title: Good choice on East side of town,

reviews.text: Stayed here while travelling on business. Two elevevators very helpful. Convenient to airport with good access into various parts of Colorado Springs yet away from any hubub. Have to drive a bit to get anywhere to eat. Breakfast was very good.
reviews.title: Excellent Choice!

reviews.text: Stayed 2 nights at this hotel which is somewhat away from the main action but not far from huge shopping/restaurant area on Powers Rd (go north from hotel < 5 Miles). Hotel was in great condition, great service and rooms were spacious and very nice. The pool and exercise room are very small but the included breakfast was very well done and has more selection than most hotels offer. It's a little further drive from some of the popular attractions but better priced during the busy season than some of the other comparable choices. It's quiet location which was a plus for us. Best reasons to recommend: breakfast is actually worthwhile choices, hotel is clean and new looking with spacious rooms for a decent price.
reviews.title: Unhappy

aka: Springhill Suites Colorado Springs South Hotel Colorado Springs
